comments.body: can you describe the step to run the test? It is not clear here.

> can you describe the step to run the test? It is not clear here.

added paragraph on verification and how to generate minigraphs. I will attach sample files.

Here is sample of the output:

[minigraphs.zip](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/files/4104742/minigraphs.zip)

> I'd better to put vlan configuration into topologies.

I view the vlan to be orthogonal to the underlying topology. If someone would like to have 2, 3, or 4 vlans with T0, this is down by adding 4 configuration file. These configuration could be combined with different T0 topos.
@tahmed-dev ok. In this case you need to introduce vlan configurations for all possible port configurations: 32 ports, 64 ports, 116 ports and so on.

> @tahmed-dev ok. In this case you need to introduce vlan configurations for all possible port configurations: 32 ports, 64 ports, 116 ports and so on.

I get your point here. I was attempting of having !!python expression in the yaml file, however I dropped it for another iteration. For testing, this could be modeled by some relation such as every 10 interface in a vlan or every nth interface in a vlan. Or we could use j2 to template the dividing interfaces across vlans.

The other point I will debate is it is simpler to split the two and the change is limited this way.
@tahmed-dev In this case we must put this logic to all tests which are using vlans. The tests need to know how each physical port is used by vlans

reviews.body: I'd better to put vlan configuration into topologies.

comments.body: @stcheng @prsunny Please review.

@msosyak I'd recommend to fix the test to test the new setting.
You can try to fix the test using increased value of  `ptf_qlen`  https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/ansible/roles/test/tasks/copp.yml#L62

Also you need to change https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/ansible/roles/test/files/ptftests/copp_tests.py#L32

Also I'd recommend to convert a packet to a `str` in `construct_packet`.
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/ansible/roles/test/files/ptftests/copp_tests.py#L464
@pavel-shirshov I have tried to play with `ptf_qlen` and `pkt_tx_count` but was not able to achieve neede pps. Convert a packet to a `str` in `construct_packet` did not help too.
@lguohan Could we merge this?

@lguohan Personally I don't like original change https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1000 which lead us to have this change.
I'd better to revert https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1000 .
@lguohan Previously copp tests tested the copp policy (how asics followed policy programmed in them). This change will change that.
suggest you to separate into two PR. the config_facts PR is blocked.

> suggest you to separate into two PR. the config_facts PR is blocked.

@lguohan Done. Here's the PR #1342

> since it is json, can you just load them into json without further parsing? Want to make sure it is easy to maintain this config fact module.

@lguohan I understand your concern, but only providing the config as is in json makes it harder to convert tests from ansible to pytest, Parsed facts also provide general maps, for exapmple 
` minigraph_port_indices` -> `config_port_indices`,
`minigraph_port_name_to_alias_map` -> `config_port_name_to_alias_map`,
`minigraph_port_alias_to_name_map` -> `config_port_alias_to_name_map`.

I propose to do one of two things:
1. Add another field `config_as_dict` with the whole config as loaded from json, allowing to get some specific fields from config without extending the module. Leave the parsing part as is for ease of moving from minigraph facts.
2. Return the facts as loaded from json, with the addition of few utility maps, like `port_indices`, `name_to_alias_map`,  `alias_to_name_map`, maybe add some port/interfaces lists. 

I believe working with unparsed config in a test can be a bit ugly, for interfaces for example always need to split by '|' to get the IP, etc.

reviews.body: since it is json, can you just load them into json without further parsing? Want to make sure it is easy to maintain this config fact module.

comments.body:
@daall in everflow_neighbor_test.py,  I didn't see "**self.mirror_stage**" was defined anywhere.  And when I run this test, 

`"ptf --test-dir acstests everflow_neighbor_test.EverflowNeighborTest   --platform-dir ptftests  --platform remote  -t \"asic_type='mellanox';hwsku='ACS-MSN3700C';router_mac='b8:59:9f:a6:28:00';src_port='7';dst_ports='7,2,11,0,1,6,13,12,14,10,15,8,5,4,9,3';dst_mirror_ports='22'\"  --relax --debug info 2>&1" `

I got this error:

```
"changed": true, "end": "2020-02-07 06:41:44.850141", "stdout": "everflow_neighbor_test.EverflowNeighborTest ... ERROR
======================================================================
ERROR: everflow_neighbor_test.EverflowNeighborTest
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "acstests/everflow_neighbor_test.py", line 194, in runTest
    self.check_mirrored_packet()
File "acstests/everflow_neighbor_test.py", line 137, in check_mirrored_packet    
if self.mirror_stage == "egress":
AttributeError: 'EverflowNeighborTest' object has no attribute'mirror_stage'

----------------------------------------------------------------------
```

could you please confirm is this a bug or I miss something?

> @daall in everflow_neighbor_test.py, I didn't see "**self.mirror_stage**" was defined anywhere

Good catch! It's defined in [`everflow_testbed`](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/6b30f92d04bde242eb3043e405b0e40f98062d3c/ansible/roles/test/tasks/everflow_testbed.yml#L2) and [`get_capabilities_info`](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/6b30f92d04bde242eb3043e405b0e40f98062d3c/ansible/roles/test/tasks/everflow_testbed/get_capabilities_info.yml#L4) but I somehow missed the commit where I extract it in `setUp`. I'll put in a PR to fix that. Thanks for the heads up! :)

All CLA requirements met.

@gord1306 , it looks like a good idea.

Great initiation for API testing providing new infrastructure.

comments.body: From the current template, with podset #=200, you must have probably tested 6400 routes w/ exabgp.  Was this done with veos or ceos? We're trying to get a sense of how much scale can be done w/ ceos on a server that has specs as mentioned here [https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/ansible/doc/README.testbed.Overview.md](here) - Dell 730; 2 CPUs each has 18 cores; 192G memory; hard disk:2X500G or equivalent? Or did you have to upgrade? Thanks.
